Package camzup.core

Class Transform3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Transform3
All Implemented Interfaces:
IOriented3, ISpatial3, IVolume, IVolume3, java.lang.Comparable<Transform3>
public class Transform3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Transform3>, ISpatial3, IOriented3, IVolume3
Facilitates 3D affine transformations for entities.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Transform3.Easing
    An easing function to facilitate animation between multiple transforms.

  • Field Summary

    Multiplies a direction by a transform's inverse.

    Multiplies a normal by a transform's inverse.

    Multiplies a point by a transform's inverse.

    Multiplies a vector by the transform's inverse.
    static Vec3 locDelta​(Transform3 t, Vec3 target)
    Finds the difference between the current and previous location of a transform.
    Transform3 lookAt​(Vec3 point, float step, Handedness handedness)
    Orients the transform to look at a target point.

    The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.
    Transform3 lookIn​(Vec3 dir, float step, Handedness handedness)
    Orients the transform to look toward a direction.

    The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.

    Returns the maximum dimension occupied by a transform.
    static float minDimension​(Transform3 t)
    Returns the minimum dimension occupied by a transform.

    Reverts this transform to its previous state, i.e., swaps current location, rotation and scale with the previous.

    Transform3 wrap​(Vec3 lb, Vec3 ub)
    Wraps the transform's location around a periodic range as defined by an upper and lower bound: lower bounds inclusive; upper bounds exclusive.

      public Transform3​(float xLoc, float yLoc, float zLoc, float real, float xImag, float yImag, float zImag, float xScale, float yScale, float zScale)
      Creates a transform from loose real numbers.
      Parameters:
      xLoc - the x location
      yLoc - the y location
      zLoc - the z location
      real - the rotation real component
      xImag - the rotation x imaginary
      yImag - the rotation y imaginary
      zImag - the rotation z imaginary
      xScale - the scale x
      yScale - the scale y
      zScale - the scale z

    • lookAt

      public Transform3 lookAt​(Vec3 point, float step, Handedness handedness)
      Orients the transform to look at a target point.

      The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.
      Parameters:
      point - the target point
      step - the step
      handedness - the handedness
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:
      Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), lookIn(Vec3, float, Handedness)

    • lookIn

      public Transform3 lookIn​(Vec3 dir, float step, Handedness handedness)
      Orients the transform to look toward a direction.

      The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      step - the step
      handedness - the handedness
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:

    • moveByLocal

      public Transform3 moveByLocal​(Vec3 dir)
      Moves the transform by a direction multiplied by the transform's rotation. Uses the formula:

      move ( dir ) := location + rotation * direction
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:
      Quaternion.mulVector(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3), Vec3.hadamard(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), Vec3.add(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • rotateX

      public Transform3 rotateX​(float radians)
      Rotates this transform around the x axis by an angle in radians. Updates the transform's axes.

      Beware that using sequences of orthonormal rotations will result in gimbal lock. Updates the transform's axes.
      Specified by:
      rotateX in interface IOriented3
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:
      Quaternion.rotateX(Quaternion, float, Quaternion), updateAxes()

      Parameters:
      locNew - the new location
      rotNew - the new rotation
      scaleNew - the new scale
      Returns:
      this transform

    • setAxes

      public Transform3 setAxes​(float xRight, float yForward, float zUp, float zForward, float yUp, float xUp, float zRight, float yRight, float xForward)
      A helper function to set the transform's from either separate vectors or from the columns of a matrix. The transform's location and scale remain unchanged.
      Parameters:
      xRight - m00 : right x
      yForward - m11 : forward y
      zUp - m22 : up z
      zForward - m21 : forward z
      yUp - m12 : up y
      xUp - m02 : up x
      zRight - m20 : right z
      yRight - m10 : right y
      xForward - m01 : forward x
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      Quaternion.fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Quaternion), updateAxes()

    • setAxes

      public Transform3 setAxes​(Vec3 right, Vec3 forward, Vec3 up)
      Sets a transform's rotation to the provided axes. The transform's location and scale remain unchanged.
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      up - the up axis
      Returns:
      the transform

      public Transform3 wrap​(Vec3 lb, Vec3 ub)

      ub - the upper bound

    • fromAxes

      public static Transform3 fromAxes​(float xRight, float yForward, float zUp, float zForward, float yUp, float xUp, float zRight, float yRight, float xForward, Transform3 target)
      A helper function to set the transform's from either separate vectors or from the columns of a matrix. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      xRight - m00 : right x
      yForward - m11 : forward y
      zUp - m22 : up z
      zForward - m21 : forward z
      yUp - m12 : up y
      xUp - m02 : up x
      zRight - m20 : right z
      yRight - m10 : right y
      xForward - m01 : forward
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      Quaternion.fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Quaternion), Vec3.one(Vec3), Vec3.zero(Vec3)

    • fromAxes

      public static Transform3 fromAxes​(Vec3 right, Vec3 forward, Vec3 up, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from axes. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      up - the up axis
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Transform3)

    • fromDir

      public static Transform3 fromDir​(Ray3 ray, Handedness handedness, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from a ray. The transform's translation is set to the ray's origin; its scale, to one.

      Discontinuities arise when using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis. To animate a transform use the instance method lookAt(Vec3, float, Handedness) .
      Parameters:
      ray - the direction
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      fromDir(Vec3, Handedness, Transform3), moveTo(Vec3)

    • fromDir

      public static Transform3 fromDir​(Vec3 dir, Handedness handedness, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from a direction. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.

      Discontinuities arise when using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis. To animate a transform use the instance method lookAt(Vec3, float, Handedness) .
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      handedness - handedness
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      Quaternion.fromDir(Vec3, Handedness, Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • fromSpherical

      public static Transform3 fromSpherical​(float azimuth, float inclination, float radius, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from spherical coordinates. The transform's right axis corresponds to the point on the sphere. The transform's scale is set to the radius. A radius of zero will return the identity transform instead.
      Parameters:
      azimuth - the angle theta in radians
      inclination - the angle phi in radians
      radius - rho, the magnitude
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform

    • fromSpherical

      public static Transform3 fromSpherical​(float azimuth, float inclination, float radius, Vec3 origin, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from spherical coordinates. The transform's right axis corresponds to the point on the sphere. The transform's scale is set to the radius. A radius of zero will return the identity transform instead.
      Parameters:
      azimuth - the angle theta in radians
      inclination - the angle phi in radians
      radius - rho, the magnitude
      origin - the sphere origin
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform

    • fromSpherical

      public static Transform3 fromSpherical​(float azimuth, float inclination, Transform3 target)
      Creates a transform from spherical coordinates. The transform's right axis corresponds to the point on the sphere. The transform's scale is set to 1.0 and its location to the origin.
      Parameters:
      azimuth - the angle theta in radians
      inclination - the angle phi in radians
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform

    • invMulNormal

      public static Vec3 invMulNormal​(Transform3 t, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a normal by a transform's inverse. This rotates the normal by the inverse quaternion, then multiplies the normal by the scale.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform

      target - the output normal

      the normal

    • invMulPoint

      public static Vec3 invMulPoint​(Transform3 t, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a point by a transform's inverse. This subtracts the translation from the point, divides the point by the scale, then rotates by the inverse quaternion.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the point
      See Also:
      Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), Vec3.div(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), Quaternion.invMulVector(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3)

    • invMulVector

      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the vector
      See Also:
      Vec3.div(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), Quaternion.invMulVector(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3)

    • mulCurveSeg

      public static Vec3 mulCurveSeg​(Transform3 t, Vec3 fhSrc, Vec3 rhSrc, Vec3 coSrc, Vec3 fhTrg, Vec3 rhTrg, Vec3 coTrg)
      Multiplies a curve segment by a transform. A convenience for drawing curves in a renderer. The segment is represented by the first control point, second control point and destination anchor point.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      fhSrc - the source fore handle
      rhSrc - the source rear handle
      coSrc - the source coordinate
      fhTrg - the target fore handle
      rhTrg - the target rear handle
      coTrg - the target coordinate
      Returns:
      the transformed coordinate

      Multiplies a normal by a transform. This divides the normal by the transform's scale and then rotates it by the transform's rotation.
      Parameters:

      source - the input normal
      target - the output normal

      the normal

    • mulPoint

      public static Vec3 mulPoint​(Transform3 t, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a point by a transform. This rotates the point, multiplies the point by the scale, then adds the translation.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the point

      public static Vec3 mulPointAndNormal​(Transform3 t, Vec3 ptSrc, Vec3 nrmSrc, Vec3 ptTrg, Vec3 nrmTrg)
      Multiplies a point and normal by a transform. A convenience for drawing mesh data. Returns the transformed point.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      ptSrc - the input point
      nrmSrc - the input normal
      ptTrg - the output point
      nrmTrg - the output normal
      Returns:
      the transformed point

    • mulVector

      public static Vec3 mulVector​(Transform3 t, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a vector by a transform. This rotates the vector by the transform's rotation and then multiplies it by the transform's scale.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input vector
      target - the output vector

      the vector

    • random

      public static Transform3 random​(java.util.Random rng, float lbLoc, float ubLoc, float lbScl, float ubScl, Transform3 target)
      Creates a random transform. Uses Vec3.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, float, float, Vec3) for location and scale.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      lbLoc - the location lower bound
      ubLoc - the location upper bound
      lbScl - the scale lower bound
      ubScl - the scale upper bound
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the random transform
      See Also:
      Vec3.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), Quaternion.random(java.util.Random, Quaternion)

    • random

      public static Transform3 random​(java.util.Random rng, Transform3 target)
      Creates a random transform. The location range is [-1.0f, 1.0f] . The scale range is [0.5773502588272095f, 1.7320507764816284f] .
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the random transform

    • random

      public static Transform3 random​(java.util.Random rng, Vec3 lbLoc, Vec3 ubLoc, Vec3 lbScl, Vec3 ubScl, Transform3 target)
      Creates a random transform. Uses Vec3.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3) for location and scale.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      lbLoc - the location lower bound
      ubLoc - the location upper bound
